channel.title: Xbox or PC?
channel.description:
So,
I can finally buy a new console for my gamery needs but I was wondering.. I have a bugdet of $700 and I was thinking about buying a PC or an xbox360. For $700 I could get a mid gamers pc (including monitor etc) to play games like skyrim on low-med setting. But for a cheaper price I can get an xbox 360 with lots of games.
So, what do you guys think? What shall I buy?

item.title: Xbox or PC?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:74, topic:445882”]Well Jmood, how often does a console come out? 10yrs? Mhm…

  1. likeliness of someone having a decent PC for the games… Not that high although it depends on who your friends are… however, a console is more likely maybe because they have brothers/sisters or because its easier.

  2. Like I said once again… You didn’t have to buy a adapter you could of just bought a cable to connect it. Even when you had to buy them, it ain’t exactly like you can’t sell it afterwards. Its also a one time thing. Paying for online… 40 quid a year is nothing which puzzles me how people think that’s a lot. Like honestly, getting everything for an xbox is cheap to me, might not be for you.

AND before all of this, It depends on what you prefer, there really ain’t a huge difference in how a game works because at the end of the day, it’s the same game.[/quote]

  1. Regardless of the length between consoles, updatability is better than buying a brand new machine (console or PC).

  2. A PC isn’t meant for multiplayer (locally) unless you build multiple machines on the same line (like an internet cafe). That would be the only reason why you would get a console, local multiplayer. Since I don’t have friends nor care about local multiplayer, I would love to be part of the mod community and enjoy my $60 ???-games-in-one.

  3. I don’t see why this is even a factor though, besides having the best possible ping in tournament matches. Paying for online AFTER paying for my internet bill seems a bit absurd. Just a money sucker.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox or PC?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:72, topic:445882”][quote author=Frell link=topic=548747.msg4030668#msg4030668 date=1340734525]

  1. Hes talking about having to buy an entire new consoles

  2. He is right. You can instantly access your entire game library from any computer on PC, good luck carrying them all when traveling.

  3. Yup

  4. Its 2012, not everyones router is 5 inches from their computer/xbox.

Those were all really good reasons
[/quote]

  1. You buy 1 console… Not 1 ever year mate. IDK wtf ur on about.

  2. who the fuck travels with a console? A bag is fine for carrying disk cases and more than likely the guy will already have the game.

  3. Like I said, U can buy the xbox with wireless inside the machine.[/quote]

  4. You will need to buy a new console, when the new one comes out or you will lose out on all the new games. Compare that to a very well build gaming rig which shouldn’t need much upgrading if any you will save a lot more money over time.

  5. You could store all your games on a NAS, oh look now you can play your games any where that has a computer decent enough to play it!

  6. Before they come out with build in wifi, you would need to buy an adapter for it. Also you still have to play on top of that for internet access.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox or PC?
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:69, topic:445882”]PC wins.

A PC can be upgraded easier and with out the pain of buying a whole new computer.

A PC has far more games then a console will with out the need of store a thousand discs around your house.

A PC has far better mods then a console ever will.

A PC doesn’t have these costly adapters that you need to buy just for wireless internet connections.

These are all facts.

No human psychology was needed in the creation of this post.[/quote]

All but one of those were shit reasons.

  1. Xbox doesn’t need to be upgraded also?
  2. a cupboard or a shelf does the trick. Most xbox/PS3 users more than likely don’t have tons of games because of the cost.
  3. Agree.
  4. That’s why you buy an inbuilt console or use a wire.

Read full topic

A PC can be upgraded easier and with out the pain of buying a whole new computer.

These are all facts.

item.title: Xbox or PC?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9`, post:66, topic:445882”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=548747.msg4030394#msg4030394 date=1340710217]
Opinions are based on many things, passed experiences and so forth… so yet another statement of yours is wrong.
[/quote]
Which part of “You haven’t mentioned anything supporting that opinion” is nullified by what an opinion is? Again, there is almost nothing to support that opinion, a pc is capable of doing everything a console is capable of with lower costs and it can do things consoles can’t at all.

My opinion on the OPs question is the same as everyone elses as I have previously stated but THAT IS BESIDE THE POINT(2 posts in a row that i’ve said that, possibly more cba scrolling up) and it has nothing to do with what we are debating about.

Where did I say that was your opinion?

I’m not mentioning things as I’m not trying to argue what one is better because in reality none is better than the other unless you make the topic more specific also yet again it has nothing to do with whats being discussed.

Yes, lower costs and more features is definitely not better, right?

The last sentence had no relevance to whats being discussed also.

Why not? It’s an opinion with nothing to back it up.

Your misunderstanding every one of my posts, read them again and post again then post a reply. However if you yet again fail to understand my posts please do not talk to me and ignore me on moparscape(theirs a button for it somewhere) because you cannot understand me and theirs no point in communicating with someone you cannot understand?

Yes oh knowledgeable one, please enlighten us as to what we are failing to understand so we might endeavour to better ourselves![/quote]
too much effort to reply to you, your not worth my time. http://www.notdoppler.com/theidiottest.php wonder how far you get in this, probably not very far.

To make this post not a spam post: the xbox and the pc both have good features.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox or PC?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:55, topic:445882”][quote author=Frell link=topic=548747.msg4028554#msg4028554 date=1340550117]
He thinks the human mind is relevant.

Console is only good because its easy to play with real life friends. Everything else points to PC being better (graphics, money, performance, progression, innovation) this isn’t art. Yes console can be PREFERRED over PC, but PC is better. You just prefer consoles, for, like you said, exclusives. Even though PC has many more games that aren’t on consoles. So PC wins in exclusives also

@Cole, nice sig lol
[/quote]
The human mind is relevent as your interacting with a console, if a monkey tried to play the consoles then to them it’d classified as shit cause they wouldn’t enjoy it. Do you know what consoles are nowadays? Look up the setup of an xbox compared to a PC…
Short story short, games consoles are specifically designed for gaming PCs in a sense

[quote]Consoles tend to be designed to do certain things very, very well, and in order to keep costs down, do other areas less well. When you are designing for a console platform, you need to exploit these advantages, and work around the disadvantages. For example, since you don’t have the processing power, or the levels of memory of a PC, you may need to come up with a simpler model for AI or environmental texture usuage.

PC’s tend to just approach any problem with brute force, and most of the technical restrictions that you place upon it are due to target spec, and project budget/ schedule issues.[/quote] I believe I have some .pdf s on console specs and their will be PC specs online somewhere for you to compare if you do not believe me.[/quote]

Why the fuck are you describing psychology between a gaming pc and a game console when it comes to gaming?

Game consoles are designed to enable as an on-the-spot access to gaming. A gaming PC may be targeted at gaming, but of course, financially you get so much more. Document processing, video codec rendering (say you’re making a video), customizing your desktop, surfing the web at top speeds (in consideration of your ISP). You get all the abilities of a modern gaming console in a gaming computer, plus the benefits of the mod community.

I don’t have a gaming pc but I’ll tell you that PC is definitely better.

Here’s a list of features that the PS3 has in common with a gaming PC.

  • Netflix
  • Amazon Videos
  • Internet Browsing
  • PLAYING GAMES
  • Trophies/Achievements
  • Save Data (Game Data)
  • Profile/Usernames/ID
  • Gaming Community
  • Store (Add-ons, extras, demos)
  • Pictures

You can do anything the console does on PC, xbox or ps3. So enough with this psychology bullshit.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox or PC?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

If you just like the feel of a controller in your hand, then you can simply buy a joypad/use one of the many mods that make it possible to use ps3/xbox controllers on your pc. All in all, pc is a better deal, you get more customisation, versatility and gaming is way cheaper than on a console, and finally all the mods will give you way more gaming hours on a single game than maybe 4 games on a console (The Elder Scrolls games on the pc aren’t even comparable to the console versions because you lack mods, which aren’t that essential but can be a lot of fun, and the console which is necessary imo. given the amount of bugs that occur in TES).

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox or PC?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:51, topic:445882”]He thinks the human mind is relevant.

Console is only good because its easy to play with real life friends. Everything else points to PC being better (graphics, money, performance, progression, innovation) this isn’t art. Yes console can be PREFERRED over PC, but PC is better. You just prefer consoles, for, like you said, exclusives. Even though PC has many more games that aren’t on consoles. So PC wins in exclusives also

@Cole, nice sig lol[/quote]
The human mind is relevent as your interacting with a console, if a monkey tried to play the consoles then to them it’d classified as shit cause they wouldn’t enjoy it. Do you know what consoles are nowadays? Look up the setup of an xbox compared to a PC…
Short story short, games consoles are specifically designed for gaming PCs in a sense

Consoles tend to be designed to do certain things very, very well, and in order to keep costs down, do other areas less well. When you are designing for a console platform, you need to exploit these advantages, and work around the disadvantages. For example, since you don’t have the processing power, or the levels of memory of a PC, you may need to come up with a simpler model for AI or environmental texture usuage.

PC’s tend to just approach any problem with brute force, and most of the technical restrictions that you place upon it are due to target spec, and project budget/ schedule issues.

I believe I have some .pdf s on console specs and their will be PC specs online somewhere for you to compare if you do not believe me.

Read full topic
